meanings.definition: A person or thing that assimilates.
meanings.sent1: The assimilators in the group helped everyone understand the new game quickly.
meanings.sent2: The assimilators in the team made sure all the members felt included and part of the project.
meanings.sent3: The assimilators at the party made sure everyone got to know each other and had a great time.
meanings.sent4: She was like an assimilator, blending seamlessly into any social situation.
meanings.sent5: The assimilators in the class were like friendly guides, helping others adapt easily.

meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the assimilation of substances.
meanings.sent1: The assimilators in the body work hard to break down food into nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The assimilators in the stomach help in absorbing essential vitamins and minerals.
meanings.sent3: The assimilators in the laboratory were so efficient that they finished the experiment in record time.
meanings.sent4: The enzyme acted like an assimilator, transforming the raw materials into usable energy.
meanings.sent5: The assimilators in the cells were like tiny workers, converting nutrients into energy for the body.
